page.title: 08HOME LIFE
page.content: Most of the dwellings in the block are old,some from Victorian times and some much earlier.There are two bungalows at West Bucks,one built recently and the other in 1938.There are two farmhouses with adjacent farm buildings,barns and shippons. Most of the other dwellings are cottages each with its own garden.In the Clovelly part there are three lodges.London Lodge,which is two houses joined by a central arch,and Hobby Lodge,a bungalow at the entrance to Hobby Drive. Many families have a television set and a telephone,and some a video recorder and music centre.Many households have either a cat or a dog or both for pets.The main meal of the day is often in the evening,following breakfast of cereal and toast and a light lunch.
